bboxes.raw_text:
MIAMI, Florida-Ed Eastman,
World Boxing Association presi-
dent, said the executive commit
tee decided to let Cassius Clay
keep his heavyweight title.


Earlier this week Lassmanhad
commented that his organization
might end recognition of Clay as
the title holder. Action was bas-
ed on the fact that the champion
had signed a contract with the
former champions Inter-Con-
tinental Promotion group before
the fight was held.

VIDA Will Not Lift
CluY's Title

ST.LOUIS = A neighbor paid a
man with truck $3.50 per hour
to steal furniture from another
neighbor.


When Mrs Cora Reeves re-
turned home last Thursday. she
was amazed to find an empty
house. She notified police.


Officers found a witness who
knew the truck driver. Police
found a twenty one year old man
who admitted he had taken the
furniture for a man who lived in
the vicinity. He had been paid
for other hot hauling jobs. too.


Police arrested three others
in the case. Mrs. Reeves fur
niture was found in a house two
blocks away.

1t is seldom necessary for a
veteran to visit a Veterans Ad-
ministration office, Wayne San
ders, Manager Of VAS Arizona
Regional Office said. 1.-THE VA
is as close as your mailbox,"
Sanders said.


Information regarding any
phase of the program for veterans
can be secured by writing to the
Veterans Administration Region
al Office, Federal Building. 230
N. First Ave., Phoenix Is, Ariz.

NEW YORK-Cassius Clay, now
known as Muhammad Ali, said
the VIDA was acting like towards
trying to take his title away. He
offered to fight three men in one
bout to prove no one could de-
feat him.


Clay remarked the VIDA must
be talking about Liston because
he was a clean living young pretty
man. Clay, a member of the
Black Muslims, plans to make a
world tour soon.

Several Phoenicians attended
the Candlelight Dinner partyheld
at Pilgrim Rest Lodge in Tucson,
Sat-, Mar. FL.


DIT. Ola Mae West was crowned
Miss Pilgrim Rest that night.


The Antler Guard unit meets
every first and third Thursday at
pm.


PISA Convention Committee
meetings are held every second
and fourth Sundays at pm.


All persons interested in bowl
ing are asked to meet at the
Lodge on April S at pm.


We are forming marching
unit and we welcome children
from ages three to high school.


Meet every Saturday at pm.


The annual pre-Easter hop will
be held Mar. u, donation ST..


Don't forget the annual Easter
Day parade of fashions. 1t will
be held Easter Sunday at pm.


Send in your choice for the
Elk of the Year award to Mrs.
Maple L. Pratt, 1915 w. Mohave.
The program will be held on
April %.

Persons who may qualify for
account executives, advertising
managers, art directors, script
writer's, publishing assistants
and many more areas should
send for complete Information.

FOR RENT
l-3 Bedroom House unfinished
$500 per month Option to buy.
6lo West Illini - AL 3-3408
Evenings.


One Bedroom furnished Apt.
Utilities Paid $1,000 per week
quiet. l2O West Elwood See
Turner. AL 3-34O8 Evenings.

Job opportunities are listed for
various professions by the Inter-
national Student Research and
Development Council. Inc. Pc.
Box 3O5, New York, N. Y. l0027.

The Naomi Missionary Society sponsored luncheon Sum- Mar
Baptist Church. ll4l E. Jefferson.


Committee members included from left Mesdames Cecil Hughes
Smith, Clinton. Violet Matthews and Ben Lggns
Mrs. Robert B. Phillips served as chairman.


Men who served the luncheon Palm Sunday from left Car
Chester l. McPherson Harry Crawford William Smith,
Harold Sublett, Harry Phillips and Robuser Strickland

paired Days, evenings, Sundays
